docs.title: Getting Started with CPD365
docs.text: Welcome! This guide will walk you through how to register, log in, and begin using CPD365.

docs.title: 📝 Step 1: Create Your Account
docs.text:
1. Visit https://cpd365.com.au
  2. Click Account in the top-right corner, then select Sign Up
  3. Fill in your:
  4. Name
  5. Email address
  6. Profession or role (e.g. Support Worker, Student Nurse)
  7. Password (create a secure one)
  8. Agree to terms and click Create Account
  9. Check your email for a verification link and confirm

docs.title: 🔑 Step 2: Log In to Your Dashboard
docs.text:
1. Go to https://cpd365.com.au
  2. Click Account > Login
  3. Enter your email and password
  4. Click Log In to access your personalized learning dashboard

docs.title: 🚀 What You Can Do After Logging In
docs.text:
• Explore courses relevant to your role
  • Track CPD hours and completions
  • Download certificates
  • Manage your account settings

Need help? Visit the Support page.

docs.title: Using the CPD365 Dashboard
docs.text: The CPD365 dashboard is your central hub for tracking progress, accessing courses, and managing your learning experience. Here's how to use it effectively.

docs.title: 🖥️ Overview of the Dashboard
docs.text: When you log in, you’ll see a clean, user-friendly interface with the following key sections:

docs.title: 🔹 My Courses
docs.text:
Shows:

  • Active (in-progress) courses
  • Completed courses
  • Course progress bars and resume buttons

Use this to quickly continue where you left off or review certificates.

docs.title: 🔹 Browse Catalog
docs.text:
Browse the full range of CPD365 courses:

  • Filter by role: NDIS, Aged Care, Student Nurse, Clinical
  • Sort by length (e.g. 1 hour, 2+ hours)
  • Click on any course to view description, outcomes, and pricing (if not on a subscription)

docs.title: 🔹 My CPD Hours
docs.text:
Automatically tracks CPD hours earned across completed courses.

  • Filter by year
  • View downloadable reports
  • Use for AHPRA or employer audits

docs.title: 🔹 Certificates
docs.text:
All completed courses generate a certificate (PDF):

  • View and download at any time
  • Includes course name, CPD hours, completion date

docs.title: 🔹 Account Settings
docs.text:
Manage your:

  • Email address and password
  • Professional role and workplace info
  • Subscription and billing (if applicable)

docs.title: 📱 Mobile-First Experience
docs.text:
The dashboard is optimized for smartphones and tablets. You can:

  • Resume courses on the go
  • Download certificates from your phone
  • Track progress from the field or clinic

docs.title: ✅ Quick Tips
docs.text:
• Bookmark https://cpd365.com.au for fast access
  • Use "My CPD Hours" to stay on top of your yearly CPD requirements
  • Refresh the dashboard after completing a course to update progress

Next: Explore Features & Account Management →

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
docs.text: Here are the most common questions about using CPD365 — from login issues to certificates and compliance.

docs.title: 🔐 Account & Login
docs.text:
Q: I forgot my password. What do I do? A: Go to the login page and click Forgot Password. You'll receive a reset link by email.

Q: Can I update my email address? A: Yes — go to Account Settings, edit your email, and save changes.

Q: My account won’t log in. A: Double-check your email and password. If the issue persists, contact info@cpd365.com.au.

docs.title: 📚 Courses & Certificates
docs.text:
Q: How do I access my courses? A: Log in, then go to My Courses or browse via Catalog to enroll.

Q: Do I get a certificate for each course? A: Yes! Once you complete the course and quiz, a certificate is automatically generated and available under Certificates.

Q: Are CPD hours automatically tracked? A: Yes. Every completed course adds to your My CPD Hours log.

docs.title: 💳 Pricing & Plans
docs.text:
Q: What are my payment options? A: You can purchase individual courses, or subscribe monthly or annually for full access.

Q: Can I cancel my subscription? A: Yes — go to Billing → Manage Subscription → Cancel Plan.

Q: Is there a discount for teams or NDIS providers? A: Yes. Contact CPD365 for group pricing options at info@cpd365.com.au.

docs.title: 📋 Compliance & Recognition
docs.text:
Q: Are CPD365 certificates accepted by AHPRA and NMBA? A: Yes. All courses are aligned with NMBA and AHPRA standards.

Q: Are the courses valid for NDIS training? A: Yes. High-intensity support modules meet NDIS Practice Standards for worker training.

Q: Do I need to report my CPD hours manually? A: CPD365 provides a downloadable log for your use during audits or annual registration.

Still need help? Visit our Support & Accessibility page →

docs.title: Features & Account Management
docs.text: This section dives into CPD365’s core features and how to manage your personal or team account for optimal use.

docs.title: 📚 Course Catalog
docs.text:
• 100% online and self-paced
  • Filter by specialty (e.g. NDIS, Midwifery, Community Care)

  • Each course displays:

  • CPD hours earned

  • Description & learning outcomes
  • Creator (all clinician-authored)

docs.title: ▶️ Course Experience
docs.text:
• Scenario-based, video-first modules
  • Interactive assessments and quizzes
  • Bookmarking and resume functionality

docs.title: 🧾 Instant Certification
docs.text:
• Digital certificates auto-generated after course completion
  • Download as PDF via the Certificates tab
  • Valid for AHPRA/NMBA and NDIS audits

docs.title: 📊 CPD Hours Tracker
docs.text:
• Real-time log of your completed CPD hours
  • Tracks per year
  • Export summary for professional or regulatory reporting

docs.title: For Individual Users
docs.text:
You can:

  • Purchase a single course
  • Subscribe monthly or annually for full access
  • Track your own CPD completion

docs.title: For Team Leaders / NDIS Providers
docs.text:
• Contact CPD365 for group subscriptions
  • Staff can register under organization’s access
  • Centralized oversight available upon request

docs.title: Update Profile Info
docs.text:
1. Go to Account Settings
  2. Edit name, email, or professional title
  3. Save changes instantly

docs.title: Change Password
docs.text:
1. In Account Settings, click Change Password
  2. Enter your current and new password

docs.title: View Subscription or Billing
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Billing
  2. View transaction history or update payment details
  3. Cancel, upgrade, or renew plans as needed

💡 Tip: Always keep your email up to date for certificate delivery and system alerts.

Ready to see how users apply this in real workflows? Continue to Workflows & Best Practices →

docs.title: Getting Started with CPD365
docs.text: Welcome to CPD365! This guide walks you through creating your account, logging in, and navigating your dashboard so you can start earning CPD hours right away.

docs.title: 📝 Step 1: Create Your Account
docs.text:
To begin using CPD365:

  1. Open your browser and go to https://cpd365.com.au
  2. Click Account in the top-right corner, then choose Sign Up

  3. Fill out the registration form:

  4. Full Name

  5. Email Address (use a personal email for long-term access)
  6. Profession/Role (e.g. "Student Nurse", "NDIS Support Worker")
  7. Password (use a strong password you'll remember)
  8. Read and agree to the Terms of Service
  9. Click Create Account
  10. Check your inbox and click the verification link to activate your account

💡 Didn’t get the email? Check your spam folder or resend it from the login screen.

docs.title: 🔑 Step 2: Log In to Your Dashboard
docs.text:
Once registered:

  1. Return to https://cpd365.com.au
  2. Click Account > Login
  3. Enter your email and password
  4. Click Log In to access your personal CPD dashboard

🧠 Tip: Bookmark the login page for quick access!

docs.title: 🚀 What You Can Do After Logging In
docs.text: Here’s a quick overview of your CPD365 Dashboard features:

docs.title: 🔍 Browse Courses
docs.text:
• Search or filter by topic, profession, or support area (e.g. NDIS, Nursing, Student)
  • Each course shows learning outcomes and CPD hours
  • Choose between pay-per-course or use your subscription

docs.title: 📘 Start Learning
docs.text:
• Courses include real-life scenarios, videos, and interactive quizzes
  • Learn at your own pace on desktop or mobile
  • Pause/resume anytime — progress is automatically saved

docs.title: 🧾 Track Your CPD Hours
docs.text:
• Your CPD dashboard keeps a real-time log of completed hours
  • Certificates are available instantly after finishing a course
  • Use your CPD Summary to support AHPRA/NMBA audits or student records

docs.title: 🧑‍💼 Manage Your Account
docs.text:
• Update your profile info (name, email, role)
  • Change your password anytime
  • Switch between subscription or per-course billing

📎 All your learning data and certificates are stored securely and available for download anytime.

Need support with setup or login? Visit the Support & Accessibility page.

docs.title: Support & Accessibility
docs.text: Need assistance? CPD365 is committed to supporting all users with accessible learning and responsive help.

docs.title: 🆘 Contact Support
docs.text:
• Email: info@cpd365.com.au
  • Phone: 1300 371 115 (Available Mon–Fri, 9:00am–5:00pm AEST)
  • Website: https://cpd365.com.au

For technical issues, billing questions, or group training inquiries, email is the fastest way to reach us.

docs.title: ♿ Accessibility Features
docs.text:
CPD365 is designed for inclusive learning:

  • Mobile-first design — accessible on any device
  • Screen reader compatible layout and alt text
  • Closed captions on all video-based courses
  • Keyboard-navigable site structure
  • Color contrast optimized for readability

If you require additional accessibility accommodations, contact us — we’re happy to help.

docs.title: 🔐 Data Privacy & Security
docs.text:
• CPD365 follows Australian privacy and security standards
  • Your CPD progress, certificates, and personal data are stored securely
  • You can request data export or deletion by emailing support

docs.title: 📖 Glossary
docs.text:
CPD: Continuing Professional Development — required for maintaining registration with AHPRA/NMBA AHPRA: Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency NMBA: Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia NDIS: National Disability Insurance Scheme — supports Australians with disability High-Intensity Support: Care requiring training (e.g. tracheostomy, PEG feeding)

We’re here to help you deliver safe, confident care — with quality training that works.

Return to Home →

docs.title: Workflows & Best Practices
docs.text: Learn how CPD365 supports real-life use cases across healthcare roles, and discover tips to stay compliant, organized, and confident in your learning.

docs.title: 👩‍⚕️ For Student Nurses
docs.text:
• Enroll in entry-level courses on patient safety, documentation, and infection control
  • Use CPD365 to prepare for clinical placements
  • Track hours for university or NMBA requirements

docs.title: 🧑‍🦽 For NDIS Support Workers
docs.text:
• Complete mandatory high-intensity training (e.g. PEG feeding, bowel care)
  • Download certificates for provider audits
  • Learn on mobile between client shifts

docs.title: 🏥 For Aged Care Nurses & Carers
docs.text:
• Take short courses on wound care, dementia, and fall prevention
  • Log CPD for annual AHPRA renewal
  • Refresh critical skills with scenario modules

docs.title: 👨‍👩‍👧 For Team Leads and Coordinators
docs.text:
• Centralize team learning through group plans
  • Assign role-specific courses
  • Collect certificates during staff evaluations or audits

docs.title: 💡 Best Practices
docs.text:
• Use filters to find the right courses quickly (e.g. by profession or topic)
  • Schedule time monthly to stay on top of CPD hour accumulation
  • Back up certificates to your local drive or cloud storage
  • Complete quizzes fully to ensure certificate generation
  • Bookmark your dashboard for daily access: cpd365.com.au

docs.title: 🔎 Tips for Compliance
docs.text:
• CPD365 courses are designed to align with:

  • NMBA’s CPD requirements (20 hours/year for nurses & midwives)

  • NDIS Practice Standards for worker training

  • Ensure you:

  • Use your full legal name on certificates

  • Maintain your CPD logs (via "My CPD Hours")
  • Retain records for at least 5 years if audited

Next: See common questions in our FAQs →
